quotes.author: William Ewart Gladstone
quotes.content: We look forward to the time when the Power of Love will replace the Love of Power. Then will our world know the blessings of peace.

quotes.author: Maurice Switzer
quotes.content: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.

quotes.author: Anonymous
quotes.content: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.

quotes.author: Jim Rohn
quotes.content: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.

quotes.author: Bob Monkhouse
quotes.content: When I die, I want to go peacefully like my grandfather did–in his sleep. Not yelling and screaming like the passengers in his car.

quotes.author: Anonymous
quotes.content: When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down “happy.” They told me I didn’t understand the assignment, and I told them they didn’t understand life.

quotes.author: Margaret Mead
quotes.content: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it’s the only thing that ever has.

quotes.author: Kent M. Keith
quotes.content: People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered. Love them anyway.

quotes.author: François (VI) (Duc de La Rochefoucauld)
quotes.content: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind blows out candles and fans fire.

quotes.author: Stacey Kramer
quotes.content: The next time you’re faced with something that’s unexpected, unwanted and uncertain, consider that it just may be a gift.

quotes.author: Fred Shero
quotes.content: To avoid criticism, say nothing, do nothing, be nothing.

quotes.author: Carl Sandburg
quotes.content: A baby is God’s opinion that life should go on.

quotes.author: Milton Berle
quotes.content: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.

quotes.author: John D. Rockefeller (Jr.)
quotes.content: I believe in the sacredness of a promise, that a man’s word should be as good as his bond; that character — not wealth or power or position — is of supreme worth.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.content: Everything in moderation, including moderation.

quotes.author: Vance Havner
quotes.content: Worry is like a rocking chair, it will give you something to do, but it won’t get you anywhere.

quotes.author: Emo Philips
quotes.content: I asked God for a bike, but I know God doesn’t work that way. So I stole a bike and asked for forgiveness.

quotes.author: Susie Loucks
quotes.content: I was out on a date recently and the guy took me horseback riding. That was kind of fun, until we ran out of quarters.

quotes.author: Thomas Paine
quotes.content: The world is my country, all mankind are my brethren and to do good is my religion.

quotes.author: Jason Bacchetta
quotes.content: I don’t feel threatened by people who ask questions. It’s those who refuse to answer them that frighten me.

quotes.author: Conan O’Brien
quotes.content: Just taught my kids about taxes by eating 38% of their ice cream.

quotes.author: Plato
quotes.content: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

quotes.author: Dave Barry
quotes.content: My therapist told me the way to achieve true inner peace is to finish what I start. So far I’ve finished two bags of M&Ms and a chocolate cake. I feel better already.

quotes.author: George Miller
quotes.content: The trouble with eating Italian food is that five or six days later, you’re hungry again.

quotes.author: Doug Larson
quotes.content: Life expectancy would grow by leaps and bounds if green vegetables smelled as good as bacon.

quotes.author: Erma Bombeck
quotes.content: The odds of going to the store for a loaf of bread and coming out with only a loaf of bread are three billion to one.

quotes.author: Rod Stewart
quotes.content: Instead of getting married again, I’m going to find a woman I don’t like and just give her a house.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.content: Patriotism is supporting your country all the time, and your government when it deserves it.

quotes.author: Walt Disney
quotes.content: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci
quotes.content: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.content: Always borrow money from a pessimist. He won’t expect it back.

quotes.author: Billy Graham
quotes.content: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are stiffened.

quotes.author: Bill McGlashen
quotes.content: Patience is something you admire in the driver behind you, but not in one ahead.

quotes.author: Rita Rudner
quotes.content: Men reach their sexual peak at eighteen. Women reach theirs at thirty-five. Do you get the feeling that God is playing a practical joke?

quotes.author: Anonymous
quotes.content: I dream of a better tomorrow, where chickens can cross the road and not be questioned about their motives.

quotes.author: William Bruce Cameron
quotes.content: Not everything that can be counted counts, and not everything that counts can be counted.

quotes.author: Bill Gates
quotes.content: I never took a day off in my twenties. Not one.

quotes.author: Vince Lombardi
quotes.content: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.

quotes.author: Henry S. Haskins
quotes.content: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

quotes.author: Anne Frank
quotes.content: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before beginning to improve the world.

quotes.author: Aristotle
quotes.content: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.

quotes.author: Bill Copeland
quotes.content: The same fence that shuts others out shuts you in.

quotes.author: Seth Godin
quotes.content: Waiting for perfect is never as smart as making progress.

quotes.author: Steven Wright
quotes.content: I couldn’t repair your brakes, so I made your horn louder.

quotes.author: Anonymous
quotes.content: America is a country where half the money is spent buying food, and the other half is spent trying to lose weight.

quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw
quotes.content: You see things; and you say “Why?” But I dream things that never were; and I say “Why not?”

quotes.author: Dudley Field Malone
quotes.content: I have never in my life learned anything from any man who agreed with me.

quotes.author: Robert Wilensky
quotes.content: We’ve all heard that a million monkeys banging on a million typewriters will eventually reproduce the entire works of Shakespeare. Now, thanks to the Internet, we know this is not true.

quotes.author: Washington Irving
quotes.content: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above them.

quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quotes.content: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.

quotes.author: Jerry Seinfeld
quotes.content: People who read the tabloids deserve to be lied to.

quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quotes.content: Every truth passes through three stages before it is recognized. In the first, it is ridiculed. In the second, it is opposed. In the third, it is regarded as self-evident.

quotes.author: Oscar Wilde
quotes.content: No man is rich enough to buy back his past.

quotes.author: Lana Turner
quotes.content: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.

quotes.author: Charles Lamb
quotes.content: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.

quotes.author: Phillips Brooks
quotes.content: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men! Do not pray for tasks equal to your powers. Pray for powers equal to your tasks!

quotes.author: Benjamin Zander
quotes.content: The conductor of an orchestra doesn’t make a sound. He depends, for his power, on his ability to make other people powerful.

quotes.author: Brandi Snyder
quotes.content: To the world you may be just one person, but to one person you may be the world.

quotes.author: Eleanor Powell
quotes.content: What we are is God’s gift to us. What we become is our gift to God.

quotes.author: Dennis Miller
quotes.content: The only way the French are going in is if we tell them we found truffles in Iraq.

quotes.author: Anonymous
quotes.content: I have to exercise early in the morning before my brain figures out what I’m doing.

quotes.author: Barbra Streisand
quotes.content: Why does a woman work ten years to change a man’s habits and then complain that he’s not the man she married?

quotes.author: Anaïs Nin
quotes.content: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.

quotes.author: Johnny Carson
quotes.content: I knew a man who gave up smoking, drinking, sex, and rich food. He was healthy right up to the day he killed himself.

quotes.author: Jack Nicholson
quotes.content: My mother never saw the irony in calling me a son-of-a-bitch.

quotes.author: David Brenner
quotes.content: Misers aren’t fun to live with, but they make wonderful ancestors.

quotes.author: Sam Levenson
quotes.content: Insanity is hereditary. You get it from your children.

quotes.author: Shirley MacLaine
quotes.content: It’s useless to hold a person to anything he says while he’s in love, drunk, or running for office.

quotes.author: Howard Ruff
quotes.content: It wasn’t raining when Noah built the ark.

quotes.author: Joe Girard
quotes.content: The elevator to success is out of order. You’ll have to use the stairs . . . one step at a time.

quotes.author: Lou Holtz
quotes.content: Never tell your problems to anyone . . . 20% don’t care and the other 80% are glad you have them.

quotes.author: Susan Cain
quotes.content: There’s zero correlation between being the best talker and having the best ideas.

quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quotes.content: It is not fair to ask of others what you are unwilling to do yourself.

quotes.author: Rodney Dangerfield
quotes.content: Bisexuality immediately doubles your chances for a date on Saturday night.

quotes.author: Martin Luther
quotes.content: Let the wife make the husband glad to come home, and let him make her sorry to see him leave.

quotes.author: Edward Everett Hale
quotes.content: I am only one; but still I am one. I cannot do everything; but still I can do something; and because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do the something that I can do.

quotes.author: Truman Capote
quotes.content: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.

quotes.author: Mark Twain
quotes.content: A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes.

quotes.author: Agatha Christie
quotes.content: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have; the older she gets the more interested he is in her.

quotes.author: János Arany
quotes.content: In dreams and in love there are no impossibilities.

quotes.author: William Drummond
quotes.content: [H]e, who will not reason, is a bigot; he, who cannot, is a fool; and he, who dares not, is a slave.

quotes.author: Robert Orben
quotes.content: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.

quotes.author: Bethany Austin
quotes.content: The most difficult years of marriage are those following the wedding.

quotes.author: Leo Buscaglia
quotes.content: Don’t smother each other. No one can grow in the shade.

quotes.author: José Maria de Eça de Queiroz
quotes.content: Politicians and diapers have one thing in common. They should both be changed regularly, and for the same reason.

quotes.author: Ann Landers
quotes.content: At every party, there are two kinds of people–those who want to go home and those who don’t. The trouble is, they are usually married to each other.

quotes.author: Isaac Asimov
quotes.content: Those people who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.

quotes.author: Margaret Fuller
quotes.content: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.

quotes.author: Alan Kay
quotes.content: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.

quotes.author: Hillel the Elder
quotes.content: If not us, who? If not now, when?
